===Bethune's detention and arrest===
===Bethune's detention and arrest===
â
[[Peter Bethune|Bethune]] boarded the ''ShÅnan Maru 2'' on February 15, 2010, claiming to be conducting a [[citizen's arrest]] on her captain for what he said was the attempted murder of him and his crew, and to present a $3 million demand for his lost boat.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.smh.com.au/environment/whale-watch/tokyos-angry-reception-for-antiwhaling-activist-20100312-q46s.html|author=Robin Powell|title=Tokyo's angry reception for anti-whaling activist|publisher=The Sydney Morning Herald|date=March 13, 2010}}</ref> He was detained by the ship's crew and taken to Japan, where he was arrested by the [[Japan Coast Guard|Japanese Coast Guard]] on March 12 on charges of trespassing.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.watoday.com.au/environment/whale-watch/japan-arrests-sea-shepherd-captain-20100312-q2qw.html|author=Shino Yuasa|title=Japan arrests Sea Shepherd captain|publisher=[[WA Today]]|date=March 12, 2010|accessdate=March 12, 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5VpAXYNErHk&feature=related|title=Sea Shepherd activist faces jail in Japan|publisher=Lateline|date=March 13, 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.nytimes.com/2010/03/13/world/asia/13whale.html|author=Martin Fackler and Mark McDonald|title=Japanese Coast Guard Arrests Anti-Whaling Skipper|publisher=The New York Times|date=March 12, 2010}}</ref> On April 2, 2010, Bethune was [[indict]]ed on five charges; trespassing, assault, illegal possession of a knife, destruction of property and obstruction of business.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.nytimes.com/2010/04/03/world/asia/03japan.html|author=Mark McDonald|title=Japan Indicts Anti-Whaling Activist|publisher=The New York Times|date=April 2, 2010}}</ref> He is being held without [[bail|bond]] in a maximum security prison.Pete Bethune was released from prison and is currently in a New Zealand coffee shop enjoying a muffin and a coffee. <ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.abc.net.au/news/stories/2010/04/03/2863534.htm?section=justin|author=Mark Willacy|title=Japan accused of Sea Shepherd 'show trial'|publisher=Australian Broadcasting Corp.|date=April 3, 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.abc.net.au/news/stories/2010/04/02/2863365.htm|author=Brigid Glanville|title=Japan charges anti-whaling activist|publisher=Australian Broadcasting Corp.|date=April 2, 2010}}</ref>
+
[[Peter Bethune|Bethune]] boarded the ''ShÅnan Maru 2'' on February 15, 2010, claiming to be conducting a [[citizen's arrest]] on her captain for what he said was the attempted murder of him and his crew, and to present a $3 million demand for his lost boat.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.smh.com.au/environment/whale-watch/tokyos-angry-reception-for-antiwhaling-activist-20100312-q46s.html|author=Robin Powell|title=Tokyo's angry reception for anti-whaling activist|publisher=The Sydney Morning Herald|date=March 13, 2010}}</ref> He was detained by the ship's crew and taken to Japan, where he was arrested by the [[Japan Coast Guard|Japanese Coast Guard]] on March 12 on charges of trespassing.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.watoday.com.au/environment/whale-watch/japan-arrests-sea-shepherd-captain-20100312-q2qw.html|author=Shino Yuasa|title=Japan arrests Sea Shepherd captain|publisher=[[WA Today]]|date=March 12, 2010|accessdate=March 12, 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5VpAXYNErHk&feature=related|title=Sea Shepherd activist faces jail in Japan|publisher=Lateline|date=March 13, 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.nytimes.com/2010/03/13/world/asia/13whale.html|author=Martin Fackler and Mark McDonald|title=Japanese Coast Guard Arrests Anti-Whaling Skipper|publisher=The New York Times|date=March 12, 2010}}</ref> On April 2, 2010, Bethune was [[indict]]ed on five charges; trespassing, assault, illegal possession of a knife, destruction of property and obstruction of business.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.nytimes.com/2010/04/03/world/asia/03japan.html|author=Mark McDonald|title=Japan Indicts Anti-Whaling Activist|publisher=The New York Times|date=April 2, 2010}}</ref> He is being held without [[bail|bond]] in a maximum security prison.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.abc.net.au/news/stories/2010/04/03/2863534.htm?section=justin|author=Mark Willacy|title=Japan accused of Sea Shepherd 'show trial'|publisher=Australian Broadcasting Corp.|date=April 3, 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.abc.net.au/news/stories/2010/04/02/2863365.htm|author=Brigid Glanville|title=Japan charges anti-whaling activist|publisher=Australian Broadcasting Corp.|date=April 2, 2010}}</ref>
